channel.title: Cars - Digg
channel.description: Cars on Digg: the best articles, videos, tweets, and original content that the web is talking about right now

item.title: $1 Million Mercedes-Benz 300 SL Roadster Unearthed After Owner Parked It For 40 Years
item.description: A single owner put less than 15,000 miles on this rare collectible before tucking it away somewhere in Indiana.

item.title: What It's Like To Shelter-In-Place While Living In A Van
item.description: When the shelter-in-place order came down, these two vanlifers embraced nature and found a way to stay safe on the road.

item.title: Ferrari Driver Casually Hits 230 MPH On The Autobahn
item.description: What happens when you combine the famously high speeds of the German autobahn with the reduced traffic caused by the coronavirus lockdown?

item.title: Why Fewer Cars On The Road Means California Is Saving $40 Million A Day
item.description: It turns out that having 15,000 fewer accidents per month can save the state some cash.

item.title: Why Infiniti Is On The Verge Of Total Collapse
item.description: Doug DeMuro explains why the luxury car brand is on its way out of business.

item.title: What's It Like To Drive A Toyota Tundra In New York City?
item.description: We spent two weeks driving around NYC in a half-ton Toyota Tundra 4×4, 1794 Crewmax Edition. It was big. Here's what we learned.

item.title: I Asked A Real Car Color Professional Hard-Hitting Questions About Car Color And Here's The Result
item.description: Despite frivolous distractions like this whole "pandemic" and "global economic shutdown" we all know that the real crisis is the Crisis of Boring Car Colors.

item.title: Last Porsche 991 Being Auctioned Off For COVID-19 Relief
item.description: Porsche and RM Sotheby's are auctioning off the last 991-generation 911 Speedster online to benefit United Way Worldwide's COVID-19 relief fund.

item.title: A Bankrupt CEO Accused Of Fraud Is Selling A Massive, $31 Million Collection Of Some Of The Most Desirable Cars In The World — Take A Tour Of The Collection
item.description: The collection includes multiple NASCAR race cars, a Ford GT supercar previously owned by Wayne Gretzky and dozens of highly sought-after classics.

item.title: The Hideous, Forgotten 2001 Dodge Concept Car That Predicted The Future Of The American Sedan
item.description: The Dodge Charger is one of the last traditional American sedans left — and Chrysler gave us a peek all the way back in 2001.

item.title: Here's What Happens When You Crash A $1 Million Supercar
item.description: Accidents involving exotic vehicles are easy fodder for headlines, but, often, that's only the start of the story.

item.title: A Gallery Of Stunning Photos Of Classic Range Rover Conversions
item.description: The Range Rover has been a notable part of motoring since the beginning of the 1970s.

item.title: The Obscure, Forgotten Spanish Jeeps Of The 1960
item.description: Under the moniker VIASA, or Vehículos Industriales y Agrícolas, these European-born Jeeps weren't ever sold in North America, and one would be hard pressed to find one for sale on either side of the Atlantic.

item.title: This Dodge Charger's Unbelievably Shoddy Repair Job Is Proof That We Can't Have Nice Things
item.description: This Dodge Charger has a shockingly rinky-dink frame as the owner apparently welded in some rusted boxed steel as a quick fix, according to The Drive.
item.kicker: IT'S NOT SUPPOSED TO LOOK LIKE THAT

item.title: This Hummer H2 Looks Hilariously Top Heavy When Affixed With Puny 13-Inch Wheels
item.description: The Hummer H2 loses a foot of ground clearance when the cheeky pranksters at Garage 54 trade in its standard wheels for 13-inch ones.

item.title: Watch A Spirited Game Of Giant Jenga Using A Tesla Jerry-Rigged To The Blocks
item.description: Ryan Trahan and his friends compete against each other in giant Jenga with a twist.

item.title: Xzibit Dishes On 'Pimp My Ride' Participants Who Got Mad At Him When Their Cars Broke Down
item.description: Rapper Xzibit reflects on his time working on the MTV program and says it's hilarious when people get mad at him because he didn't "fix sh*t on the show."
item.kicker: 'I DIDN'T DO SH*T TO THAT CAR'

item.title: Could You Run A Motorcycle Engine Off Honey Instead Of Oil?
item.description: How well does a motorcycle run with honey instead of oil?

item.title: How I Turned A Free Jeep Grand Wagoneer Into A Decent Example Of A True Classic
item.description: When I took ownership of my free Jeep Grand Wagoneer last summer, I had low expectations. The Jeep hadn't run in many years, it was filled with mouse crap and it was fairly rusty. But after some wrenching and cleaning, I've now got a decent example of one of the most value-appreciating Jeeps in all of the land. Check it out.

item.title: This Is How Sudanese Militants Get Their Hands On So Many Toyota Pickups
item.description: But how did Global Witness track these Toyotas down? How do they know that they're the same allotment of pickups? It's rather impressive, actually.

item.title: Inside The World Of Hot Wheels Rally Car Racing
item.description: It might not be nearly as big as Formula One, but it's every bit as dramatic and fun.

item.title: Trump's New Auto Rollback Is An Economic Disaster
item.description: According to the administration's own math, the pollution rules could eliminate jobs, discourage driving, and inflict billions in damage.

item.title: Banned Personalized License Plates
item.description: Vanity license plates can be fun, but be aware the Department of Motor Vehicles does not take kindly to requests for BIGFART and DAPOOP.

item.title: Dunkin', Classic Rock And The Open Road: An Ode To Driving In America
item.description: A Brit learns to love roadtripping in the USA.

item.title: How This 2001 Volvo Got Stuck On A Tiny Island In A Flooded Strip Mine — And Stayed There For 8 Years
item.description: The solitary Volvo has lorded over its little isle since early January 2012.

item.title: Municipal Coordinator's TV Interview About New Speed Bumps Interrupted By Truck Driver Ramping Off One At High Speed
item.description: Well, it's back to the drawing board for the municipality of Romelândia in Brazil.

item.title: Which Cars Will Be The Last To Offer A Manual Transmission?
item.description: Manual transmissions still enjoy huge market share overseas, but the numbers are in decline, and the vehicle classes keeping it alive are not what you think.

item.title: Remembering The Nucleon, Ford's 1958 Nuclear-Powered Concept Car That Never Was
item.description: The 1950s was a different time for car design. It represented an abstract belief of the future. Take Ford's nuclear-powered concept as one example.

item.title: Woman Is Shocked At The Very Critical Error This Truck Driver Made
item.description: While driving in Oahu, a woman was shocked by what this truck had done.

item.title: A Strange Little Car Company You've Never Heard Of Has Basically The Same Exact Logo As Ferrari
item.description: I think Ferrari never bothered with them because it might have revealed a possibly uncomfortable truth about the origin of Ferrari's famous badge.

item.title: The Insane Suspension Systems On Off-Road Race Cars, Illustrated In Slow Motion
item.description: Off-road racing is absolutely brutal on the cars, but it sure is fun to watch.

item.title: McLaren Thinks Synthetic Fuel Could Save The Engine As We Know It
item.description: The technology could be a battery-electric alternative and still reduce emissions when taking battery production into account.

item.title: Boat Makes A Run For The Water, After Owner Tries To Tie It Down To The Truck
item.description: Sometimes you don't need to be assisted, you just want to run free.

item.title: A Team Exploited The Coronavirus Pandemic To Set A 26-Hour 38-Minute Cross-Country Driving Record
item.description: Cross-country Cannonball record purists are criticizing the run as grossly irresponsible while the nation deals with an emergency of unseen magnitude.

item.title: The Lost And The Furious: Films That Tried (And Failed) To Ride The 'Fast & Furious' Wave
item.description: Naturally, the success of the Fast and Furious films has spawned a number cheap rip-offs and these are the worst offenders.

item.title: Tesla Model Y Deep Dive Reveals A Much Better Engineered Car Than The Model 3
item.description: Automobile benchmarking company Munro & Associates is well known for having criticized the Tesla Model 3, with founder Sandy Munro calling the car's quality flaws similar to "a Kia in the '90s."

item.title: Owner Of Ultra-Rare Porsche Goes For Joy Ride On Locked Down Manhattan Streets, Totals His Car
item.description: Things aren't going so well for the owner of this highly-modified Porsche Carrera GT.

item.title: Ford Needs Your Help Figuring Out What's Up With This Mysterious Mid-Engine Mustang Prototype
item.description: A set of photos from 1966 has left Mustang experts reeling over what this two-seater concept might be.

item.title: Turns Out, Traffic Spreads Like The Coronavirus
item.description: Researchers use models meant for infectious diseases to show how congestion proliferates. That may mean a vaccine for traffic jams is on the horizon.
item.kicker: WE'RE GONNA HAVE CAR QUARANTINE NEXT

item.title: I Spent $8,085 To Build My Pro Sim Racing Rig. Here's What I Bought
item.description: Pro driver Robb Holland breaks down exactly what he spent to build a quarantine sim-racing rig.

item.title: Electric Harley-Davidson Smokes A Tesla Model 3 In A Drag Race
item.description: The LiveWire is the legendary motorcycle maker's first electric bike, and it does not mess around.

item.title: Crash Testers Crash A Van Loaded With 1,700 Pounds Concrete Blocks Into A Wall At 30 MPH
item.description: If you find yourself driving around with a pallet of concrete blocks in the back of your van, make sure you *really* secure that pallet.

item.title: Tesla Shows Off Its Ventilator Made Using Model 3 EV Parts
item.description: Tesla's EV plants are shuttered due to the coronavirus, but like other automakers, it's retooling its operations to build ventilators.
item.kicker: LIKE A TRANSFORMER BUT FOR PUBLIC HEALTH

item.title: Sheltering In Place? Start Your Car Once A Week, And Other Basic Tips
item.description: Being completely sedentary is bad for cars, not just people.

item.title: Biker Narrowly Misses Getting Hit By A Spinning Pickup Truck
item.description: A close call from the streets in Surat Thani, Thailand.

item.title: There's No Limo More Extreme Than This $1M Learjet-Turned-Party Rig
item.description: The 42-foot-long creation is indeed road legal, even if it's ridiculously hard to drive.

item.title: The Cheapest Dirt Bike You Can Buy On Amazon Compared With The Most Expensive One
item.description: YouTubers compare the differences between a $747 125cc dirt bike with a $950 model.
item.kicker: YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR

item.title: Car Detailer Cleans Up A $1 Million Car That's Been Sitting In A Secret Warehouse For 32 Years
item.description: There are only a two known V8 Bizzarrini P538s in existence, and one was sitting under layers of dirt in a secret warehouse.

item.title: The Story Of Richard Petty's Dad Protesting His First NASCAR Win
item.description: Before Richard Petty became a racing legend, his dad, Lee, was hellbent on making sure he earned every win.

item.title: YouTubers Put 12,000 Pounds Of Wet Concrete In The Back Of Their Ford Super Duty Truck — What Could Go Wrong?
item.description: The 2017 Ford F-350 Super Duty has a payload capacity of 4,000-pounds. What if you went considerably above that? A YouTuber attempted it.
